intro: Ornithogalum regale, commonly known as the crown imperial, is a striking plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sturdy stems that bear large, showy flower clusters. The flowers are typically white or pale purple, arranged in a crown-like pattern, giving the plant its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in rocky or gravelly habitats. Ornithogalum regale is also known for its toxic properties, containing compounds that can be harmful to humans and animals.
